import Mathlib

open Set

/-- A (classical) definition of a covering map f : E → B. -/
structure IsCoveringMap {E B : Type _} [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop where
  continuous : Continuous f
  surjective : Function.Surjective f
  -- Local triviality: for every b there is an open neighbourhood U of b such that
  -- f ⁻¹' U is a disjoint union of open sets V i, each mapped homeomorphically onto U.
  local_triviality : ∀ b : B,
    ∃ (U : Set B) (hU : IsOpen U) (hb : b ∈ U) (I : Type _) (V : I → Set E),
      (∀ i, IsOpen (V i)) ∧ (∀ i, V i ⊆ f ⁻¹' U) ∧ (∀ (i j : I), i ≠ j → Disjoint (V i) (V j)) ∧
      (f ⁻¹' U = ⋃ i, V i) ∧ (∀ i, ∃ (φ : Homeomorph (Subtype (V i)) (Subtype U)),
        ∀ x : Subtype (V i), (φ.toFun x : B) = f x)

/-- We say E is a covering space of B if there exists a covering map E → B. -/
def IsCoveringSpace (E B : Type _) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] : Prop :=
  ∃ f : E → B, IsCoveringMap f

/-- Main statement: if R is a covering space of X then X is homeomorphic to R or S^1. -/
theorem only_spaces_with_real_as_covering_space (X : Type _) [TopologicalSpace X] :
  (IsCoveringSpace Real X) → (Homeomorph X Real) ∨ (Homeomorph X Circle) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

/-- A (classical) definition of a covering map f : E → B. -/
structure MyIsCoveringMap {E B : Type _} [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop where
  continuous : Continuous f
  surjective : Function.Surjective f
  -- Local triviality: for every b there is an open neighbourhood U of b such that
  -- f ⁻¹' U is a disjoint union of open sets V i, each mapped homeomorphically onto U.
  local_triviality : ∀ b : B,
    ∃ (U : Set B) (hU : IsOpen U) (hb : b ∈ U) (I : Type _) (V : I → Set E),
      (∀ i, IsOpen (V i)) ∧ (∀ i, V i ⊆ f ⁻¹' U) ∧ (∀ (i j : I), i ≠ j → Disjoint (V i) (V j)) ∧
      (f ⁻¹' U = ⋃ i, V i) ∧ (∀ i, ∃ (φ : Homeomorph (Subtype (V i)) (Subtype U)),
        ∀ x : Subtype (V i), (φ.toFun x : B) = f x)

/-- We say E is a covering space of B if there exists a covering map E → B. -/
def MyIsCoveringSpace (E B : Type _) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] : Prop :=
  ∃ f : E → B, MyIsCoveringMap (f := f)

/-- Main statement: if R is a covering space of X then X is homeomorphic to R or S^1. -/
theorem only_spaces_with_real_as_covering_space (X : Type _) [TopologicalSpace X] :
  (MyIsCoveringSpace Real X) → (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Real)) ∨ (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Circle)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

universe u v

/-- A (classical) definition of a covering map f : E → B. -/
structure MyIsCoveringMap (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop where
  continuous : Continuous f
  surjective : Function.Surjective f
  -- Local triviality: for every b there is an open neighbourhood U of b such that
  -- f ⁻¹' U is a disjoint union of open sets V i, each mapped homeomorphically onto U.
  local_triviality : ∀ b : B,
    ∃ (U : Set B) (hU : IsOpen U) (hb : b ∈ U) (I : Type _) (V : I → Set E),
      (∀ i, IsOpen (V i)) ∧ (∀ i, V i ⊆ f ⁻¹' U) ∧ (∀ (i j : I), i ≠ j → Disjoint (V i) (V j)) ∧
      (f ⁻¹' U = ⋃ i, V i) ∧ (∀ i, ∃ (φ : Homeomorph (Subtype (V i)) (Subtype U)),
        ∀ x : Subtype (V i), (φ.toFun x : B) = f x)

/-- We say E is a covering space of B if there exists a covering map E → B. -/
def MyIsCoveringSpace (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] : Prop :=
  ∃ f : E → B, MyIsCoveringMap E B (f := f)

/-- Main statement: if R is a covering space of X then X is homeomorphic to R or S^1. -/
theorem only_spaces_with_real_as_covering_space (X : Type _) [TopologicalSpace X] :
  (MyIsCoveringSpace ℝ X) → (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Real)) ∨ (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Circle)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

universe u v w

/-- A (classical) definition of a covering map f : E → B. -/
structure MyIsCoveringMap (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop where
  continuous : Continuous f
  surjective : Function.Surjective f
  -- Local triviality: for every b there is an open neighbourhood U of b such that
  -- f ⁻¹' U is a disjoint union of open sets V i, each mapped homeomorphically onto U.
  local_triviality : ∀ b : B,
    ∃ (U : Set B) (hU : IsOpen U) (hb : b ∈ U) (I : Type w) (V : I → Set E),
      (∀ i, IsOpen (V i)) ∧ (∀ i, V i ⊆ f ⁻¹' U) ∧ (∀ (i j : I), i ≠ j → Disjoint (V i) (V j)) ∧
      (f ⁻¹' U = ⋃ i, V i) ∧ (∀ i, ∃ (φ : Homeomorph (Subtype (V i)) (Subtype U)),
        ∀ x : Subtype (V i), (φ.toFun x : B) = f x)

/-- We say E is a covering space of B if there exists a covering map E → B. -/
def MyIsCoveringSpace (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] : Prop :=
  ∃ f : E → B, MyIsCoveringMap E B (f := f)

/-- Main statement: if R is a covering space of X then X is homeomorphic to R or S^1. -/
theorem only_spaces_with_real_as_covering_space (X : Type v) [TopologicalSpace X] :
  (MyIsCoveringSpace Real X) → (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Real)) ∨ (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Circle)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

universe u v w

/-- A (classical) definition of a covering map f : E → B. -/
structure MyIsCoveringMap (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop where
  continuous : Continuous f
  surjective : Function.Surjective f
  -- Local triviality: for every b there is an open neighbourhood U of b such that
  -- f ⁻¹' U is a disjoint union of open sets V i, each mapped homeomorphically onto U.
  local_triviality : ∀ b : B,
    ∃ (U : Set B) (hU : IsOpen U) (hb : b ∈ U) (I : Type w) (V : I → Set E),
      (∀ i, IsOpen (V i)) ∧ (∀ i, V i ⊆ f ⁻¹' U) ∧ (∀ (i j : I), i ≠ j → Disjoint (V i) (V j)) ∧
      (f ⁻¹' U = ⋃ i, V i) ∧ (∀ i, ∃ (φ : Homeomorph (Subtype (V i)) (Subtype U)),
        ∀ x : Subtype (V i), (φ.toFun x : B) = f x)

/-- We say E is a covering space of B if there exists a covering map E → B. -/
def MyIsCoveringSpace (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] : Prop :=
  ∃ f : E → B, MyIsCoveringMap.{u v w} E B (f := f)

/-- Main statement: if R is a covering space of X then X is homeomorphic to R or S^1. -/
theorem only_spaces_with_real_as_covering_space (X : Type v) [TopologicalSpace X] :
  (MyIsCoveringSpace Real X) → (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Real)) ∨ (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Circle)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

universe u v w

/-- A (classical) definition of a covering map f : E → B. -/
structure MyIsCoveringMap (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop where
  continuous : Continuous f
  surjective : Function.Surjective f
  -- Local triviality: for every b there is an open neighbourhood U of b such that
  -- f ⁻¹' U is a disjoint union of open sets V i, each mapped homeomorphically onto U.
  local_triviality : ∀ b : B,
    ∃ (U : Set B) (hU : IsOpen U) (hb : b ∈ U) (I : Type w) (V : I → Set E),
      (∀ i, IsOpen (V i)) ∧ (∀ i, V i ⊆ f ⁻¹' U) ∧ (∀ (i j : I), i ≠ j → Disjoint (V i) (V j)) ∧
      (f ⁻¹' U = ⋃ i, V i) ∧ (∀ i, ∃ (φ : Homeomorph (Subtype (V i)) (Subtype U)),
        ∀ x : Subtype (V i), (φ.toFun x : B) = f x)

/-- We say E is a covering space of B if there exists a covering map E → B. -/
def MyIsCoveringSpace (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] : Prop :=
  ∃ f : E → B, MyIsCoveringMap.{u v w} E B f

/-- Main statement: if R is a covering space of X then X is homeomorphic to R or S^1. -/
theorem only_spaces_with_real_as_covering_space (X : Type v) [TopologicalSpace X] :
  (MyIsCoveringSpace Real X) → (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Real)) ∨ (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Circle)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

universe u v

/-- A simplified definition of a covering map f : E → B (placeholder for local triviality). -/
structure MyIsCoveringMap (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop where
  continuous : Continuous f
  surjective : Function.Surjective f
  -- Placeholder for the usual local triviality condition
  local_triviality : Prop

/-- We say E is a covering space of B if there exists a covering map E → B. -/
def MyIsCoveringSpace (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] : Prop :=
  ∃ f : E → B, MyIsCoveringMap E B f

/-- Main statement: if R is a covering space of X then X is homeomorphic to R or S^1. -/
theorem only_spaces_with_real_as_covering_space (X : Type v) [TopologicalSpace X] :
  (MyIsCoveringSpace Real X) → (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Real)) ∨ (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Circle)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

universe u v w

/-- A (classical) definition of a covering map f : E → B. -/
def IsCoveringMap (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop :=
  Continuous f ∧ Function.Surjective f ∧
  (∀ b : B, ∃ (U : Set B) (hU : IsOpen U) (hb : b ∈ U) (I : Type w) (V : I → Set E),
    (∀ i, IsOpen (V i)) ∧ (∀ i, V i ⊆ f ⁻¹' U) ∧ (∀ (i j : I), i ≠ j → Disjoint (V i) (V j)) ∧
    (f ⁻¹' U = ⋃ i, V i) ∧ (∀ i, ∃ (φ : Homeomorph (Subtype (V i)) (Subtype U)),
      ∀ x : Subtype (V i), (φ.toFun x : B) = f x))

/-- We say E is a covering space of B if there exists a covering map E → B. -/
def IsCoveringSpace (E : Type u) (B : Type v) [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] : Prop :=
  ∃ f : E → B, IsCoveringMap (E := E) (B := B) (f := f)

/-- Main statement: if ℝ is a covering space of X then X is homeomorphic to ℝ or S^1. -/
theorem only_spaces_with_real_as_covering_space (X : Type v) [TopologicalSpace X] :
  IsCoveringSpace (E := Real) (B := X) → (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Real)) ∨ (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Circle)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

universe v

/-- There exists a covering map p : ℝ → X (full local triviality formalised). -/
def IsCoveringMapReal (X : Type v) [TopologicalSpace X] : Prop :=
  ∃ (f : Real → X),
    Continuous f ∧ Function.Surjective f ∧
    (∀ b : X, ∃ (U : Set X) (hU : IsOpen U) (hb : b ∈ U) (I : Type) (V : I → Set Real),
      (∀ i, IsOpen (V i)) ∧ (∀ i, V i ⊆ f ⁻¹' U) ∧ (∀ (i j : I), i ≠ j → Disjoint (V i) (V j)) ∧
      (f ⁻¹' U = ⋃ i, V i) ∧ (∀ i, ∃ (φ : Homeomorph (Subtype (V i)) (Subtype U)),
        ∀ x : Subtype (V i), (φ.toFun x : X) = f x))

/-- Main statement: if ℝ covers X then X is homeomorphic to ℝ or S^1. -/
theorem only_spaces_with_real_as_covering_space (X : Type v) [TopologicalSpace X] :
  IsCoveringMapReal X → (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Real)) ∨ (Nonempty (Homeomorph X Circle)) := by sorry
